description.narrative: San Miguel runs a capital intensive business as citrus trees take an average of 5-7 years to reach maturity. The proposed 6-year A loan (US$5 million) & B loan (US$20 million) would allow San Miguel to maintain an adequate balance sheet structure by replacing loans due in the coming 2 years with longer maturities.

The project would help to: (i) improve the debt structure of the Company by replacing financial debt maturing in the next two years with long term debt; (ii) assist the Company to continue its investment program in a frontier region in Argentina (province of Tucuman); (iii) support the final completion of an innovative waste water treatment designed to adress the specific and difficult effluent issue faced by San Miguel; (iv) provide economic benefits for Tucuman, a frontier region, and benefit local farmers, workers and affiliated enterprises; (v) maintain the financial flexibility of San Miguel in order to continue its South-South investments in Uruguay and South Africa.

participating-org.narrative: S.A. SAN MIGUEL A.G.I.C.I. y F.

mailing-address.narrative: Mr. Alejandro Daireaux CFOS.A. San Miguel A.G.I.C.I. y.F. Cazadores de Coquimbo 2860, 2nd Building, 1st Floor (1605) Vicente López, Bs. As., Argentina Tel: + 54 11 4721 8300

name.narrative: San Miguel owns and operates several plantations in the Tucuman, a region in the northern part of Argentina where the climatic conditions and the quality of the soils is ideal for citrus growing. The companys packing and processing plants are located in San Miguel de Tucuman and Famaillá respectively.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
